import React, { useState } from 'react'; import { useNavigate } from 'react-router-dom'; function SocialMediaPage() { const navigate = useNavigate(); const [selectedPlatform, setSelectedPlatform] = useState(null); const socialPlatforms = [ { id: 'instagram', name: 'Instagram', description: 'Automate posts, stories, and engagement on Instagram', color: '#E4405F', gradient: 'linear-gradient(45deg, #f09433 0%,#e6683c 25%,#dc2743 50%,#cc2366 75%,#bc1888 100%)', icon: ( ), features: ['Auto-posting', 'Story scheduling', 'Hashtag optimization', 'Engagement tracking'] }, { id: 'facebook', name: 'Facebook', description: 'Manage Facebook pages and automate your social presence', color: '#1877F2', gradient: 'linear-gradient(45deg, #1877F2, #42a5f5)', icon: ( ), features: ['Page management', 'Ad campaigns', 'Audience insights', 'Content scheduling'] } ]; return (

Social Media Automation

Connect and automate your social media platforms

{socialPlatforms.map((platform) => (
setSelectedPlatform(selectedPlatform === platform.id ? null : platform.id)} style={{'--platform-color': platform.color, '--platform-gradient': platform.gradient}} >
{platform.icon}

{platform.name}

{platform.description}

Features:

    {platform.features.map((feature, index) => (
  • {feature}
    • ))}
))}
{selectedPlatform && (

Configure {socialPlatforms.find(p => p.id === selectedPlatform)?.name} Automation

)}
); } export default SocialMediaPage;
